alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:51PM EST until February 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Hiram Rapids, Phalanx Station, Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, flooding begins on Braceville Robinson Road. Portions of Barcley Messerly Road south of Eagle Creek Road will be impassable. Some homes will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river level is forecast to fall gradually and should fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 900 AM EST.
